medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital systemic glutamine deficiency in neonates with severe brain malformations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms presented at birth in both newborns. Patient 1 showed neurological compromise, marked flaccidity, and cardiac insufficiency, leading to death at two days of life. Patient 2 displayed convulsions and respiratory failure on the first day of life, deteriorating with enteropathy and dying by the fourth week of life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patients both had congenital glutamine synthetase deficiency due to specific gene mutations (R324C and R341C). Previous pregnancy termination in the mother of Patient 1 due to abnormal ultrasonography.
medical_history.family_history: Both patients were born to consanguineous Turkish parents. Family history suggests an autosomal recessive inheritance pattern.
